basics.name: Hauke Sandhaus
basics.label: HCI Researcher & UX Technologist
basics.summary: PhD Candidate in Information Science at Cornell Tech, working on enabling technology designers to develop for positive societal impact while navigating external influences, unaccounted for in today's user-centered design processes. Experienced in responsible and efficient design innovation methodologies to empower designers.

work.name: Cornell Tech
work.summary: Working under the advisement of assistant professor Qian Yang and co-advised by associate professor Wendy Ju, focusing on transparent AI & autonomous vehicle interaction. Research focuses on enabling technology designers to develop for positive societal impact while navigating external influences.
highlights: Developing frameworks for responsible and efficient design innovation methodologies
Researching approaches to empower designers to navigate external influences in user-centered design processes
Exploring ethical considerations in technology design with a focus on societal impact

work.name: Center for Responsible AI at NYU
work.summary: Worked on the 'University of Notre Dame - IBM' Technology Ethics Lab Grant Auditing AI Initiative on the project 'Expanding AI Audits to Include Instruments: Accountability, Measurements, and Data in Motion Capture Technology.'
highlights: Collaborated with researchers from University of Michigan, Intel Labs, and New York University on an award-winning CHI publication
Investigated bias in measurement standards for AI hardware
Contributed to frameworks for auditing AI technologies

work.name: Volkswagen Group Future Center
work.summary: Led the design of inclusive user experiences for fully autonomous vehicles and developed next-generation driver interfaces. Involved in the creation and transformation of CARIAD.
highlights: Improved User Experience Questionnaire (UEQ) benchmarks by 30% over state-of-the-art through inclusive design approaches
Developed and implemented a next-generation digital cockpit that improved accessibility of steering wheel functions without affecting driving performance
Created high-fidelity AI prototypes using cutting-edge research papers and custom computer vision pipelines that were adopted for production development
Conducted on-road studies for ambient in-cabin lighting systems that identified critical safety, comfort, and motion sickness factors for AV passengers
Designed and prototyped LLM-based digital assistant interfaces for in-vehicle use, now in final stages before market release
Established GDPR-compliant research practices that were adopted across the VW Group
Successfully transferred multiple vision projects to strategy teams, with implementations adopted by Porsche, Skoda, and Audi

work.name: Robert Bosch
work.summary: Designed V2X interfaces and researched interfaces for autonomous vehicles tailored for older adults and disabled users.
highlights: Conducted research on autonomous vehicle interfaces for older adults and people with disabilities
Designed Vehicle-to-Everything (V2X) interfaces for future mobility solutions

work.name: ELIXIER
work.summary: Conducted usability testing of multimodal and augmented workbenches for educational purposes and developed an AR manual for chemistry experiments.

work.name: 100%FAT
work.summary: Designed, developed, and evaluated a prototype for a touchless interactive showcase in the DesignLab Twente. The prototype was permanently installed in the Design Hall.

work.name: Twente Academy
work.summary: Taught upper secondary school pupils programming using the Arduino microprocessor.

volunteer.summary: Managed the website, sign-ups, and the poster and demo track for NYC Privacy Day, an initiative between privacy research institutes in the NYC area.

volunteer.position: Instructor Ethics for Public Interest Technology
volunteer.summary: Co-instructed ethics workshop on conscientious technology design, developing materials, and leading activities on value-driven design thinking (pitechethics.github.io). With Helen Nissenbaum.

volunteer.position: Teaching Assistant in Privacy in the Digital Age
volunteer.summary: Head TA in master level privacy class. Led assignments, in-class privacy policy exercise and a lecture on usable privacy. With Helen Nissenbaum and Vitaly Shmatikov.

volunteer.position: Teaching Assistant in Interactive Device Design
volunteer.summary: Head TA in master level prototyping class. Maintained project code repository, labs, and oversaw grading. Updated the class for AI-codesign of technology. With Wendy Ju.
Information Science Graduate Student Association Liaison for NYC to Ithaca campus collaboration.
Assisted in teaching undergraduate and master level course in human computer interaction. Oversaw grading and individual sections. With Gilly Leshed.
Member of the VW network to advocate being out at work.

awards.title: DLI Doctoral Fellow
awards.summary: The Digital Life Initiative supports examining the complexities and tensions present in digital technologies involving ethics, policy, politics, and quality of life.

awards.title: Siegel Public Interest Technology Impact Fellowship
awards.summary: Funded to work for not-for-profit organization YAI. YAI is one of the largest organizations in the U.S. providing children and adults with intellectual and developmental disabilities (I/DD) a comprehensive range of services.

awards.title: Thesis of the Year
awards.summary: Selected by jury to speak at graduation ceremony. Bachelor thesis presented on behalf of the creative technology program.

certifications.title: Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) 5.0
certifications.summary: Certified SAFe Agilist (SA) demonstrates knowledge in applying the Scaled Agile Framework, lean thinking, and product development flow principles in an enterprise context.

projects.name: Benevolent User Interface Design
projects.description: Developing frameworks to counteract dark patterns with 'bright patterns' that prioritize user goals and well-being over their desires and business objectives.
highlights: Created brightpatterns.org to catalog and promote benevolent design solutions by corporations, seemingly acting against their short-term best interest.
Created the survey tool UEEQ.org to quantify ethical user experience metrics to evaluate interface design.

projects.name: Enabling Appropriate Dataflows
projects.description: Investigating methods to promote data sharing and transparency.
highlights: Developing onboarding flows to encourage transparent data sharing that enables AI models for societal good.
Researching large scale dataset privacy risks on groups and developing frameworks to enable use of them through contextual integrity.

projects.name: Responsible AI Innovation
projects.description: Auditing AI hardware for historical bias in measurement standards.
highlights: Encouraging regulatory sandboxing in high-risk domains to enable innovation with appropriate guardrails.
Exploring how startups can prototype policy, business models, and technology simultaneously.

projects.name: Modeling Human Driving Interaction
projects.description: Understanding cross-cultural differences in driving behaviors using virtual reality environments.
highlights: Developing frameworks for autonomous vehicles with enhanced social capabilities.
Researching human-machine interaction patterns for mixed-autonomy traffic scenarios.
